dl.dd: Serializable, Cloneable, Map<K,V>
Properties, UIDefaults

li.pre: public class Hashtable<K,V> extends Dictionary<K,V> implements Map<K,V>, Cloneable, Serializable

dl.dd: JDK1.0
Object.equals(java.lang.Object), Object.hashCode(), rehash(), Collection, Map, HashMap, TreeMap, Serialized Form

li.div: Constructs a new, empty hashtable with the specified initial capacity and the specified load factor.

dl.dd: initialCapacity - the initial capacity of the hashtable.
loadFactor - the load factor of the hashtable.
IllegalArgumentException - if the initial capacity is less than zero, or if the load factor is nonpositive.

li.div: Constructs a new, empty hashtable with the specified initial capacity and default load factor (0.75).

dl.dd: initialCapacity - the initial capacity of the hashtable.
IllegalArgumentException - if the initial capacity is less than zero.

li.div: Constructs a new, empty hashtable with a default initial capacity (11) and load factor (0.75).

li.pre: public Hashtable(Map<? extends K,? extends V> t)
li.div: Constructs a new hashtable with the same mappings as the given Map. The hashtable is created with an initial capacity sufficient to hold the mappings in the given Map and a default load factor (0.75).

dl.dd: t - the map whose mappings are to be placed in this map.
NullPointerException - if the specified map is null.

li.div: Returns the number of keys in this hashtable.

size in class Dictionary<K,V>
the number of keys in this hashtable.

li.div: Tests if this hashtable maps no keys to values.

dl.dd: isEmpty in interface Map<K,V>
isEmpty in class Dictionary<K,V>
true if this hashtable maps no keys to values; false otherwise.

li.div: Returns an enumeration of the keys in this hashtable.

dl.dd: keys in class Dictionary<K,V>
an enumeration of the keys in this hashtable.
Enumeration, elements(), keySet(), Map

li.div: Returns an enumeration of the values in this hashtable. Use the Enumeration methods on the returned object to fetch the elements sequentially.

dl.dd: elements in class Dictionary<K,V>
an enumeration of the values in this hashtable.
Enumeration, keys(), values(), Map

li.div:
Tests if some key maps into the specified value in this hashtable. This operation is more expensive than the containsKey method.
Note that this method is identical in functionality to containsValue, (which is part of the Map interface in the collections framework).

dl.dd: value - a value to search for
true if and only if some key maps to the value argument in this hashtable as determined by the equals method; false otherwise.
NullPointerException - if the value is null

li.div:
Returns true if this hashtable maps one or more keys to this value.
Note that this method is identical in functionality to contains (which predates the Map interface).

dl.dd: containsValue in interface Map<K,V>
value - value whose presence in this hashtable is to be tested
true if this map maps one or more keys to the specified value
NullPointerException - if the value is null

li.div: Tests if the specified object is a key in this hashtable.

dl.dd: containsKey in interface Map<K,V>
key - possible key
true if and only if the specified object is a key in this hashtable, as determined by the equals method; false otherwise.
NullPointerException - if the key is null

li.div:
Returns the value to which the specified key is mapped, or null if this map contains no mapping for the key.
More formally, if this map contains a mapping from a key k to a value v such that (key.equals(k)), then this method returns v; otherwise it returns null. (There can be at most one such mapping.)

dl.dd: get in interface Map<K,V>
get in class Dictionary<K,V>
key - the key whose associated value is to be returned
the value to which the specified key is mapped, or null if this map contains no mapping for the key
NullPointerException - if the specified key is null

li.div: Increases the capacity of and internally reorganizes this hashtable, in order to accommodate and access its entries more efficiently. This method is called automatically when the number of keys in the hashtable exceeds this hashtable's capacity and load factor.

li.pre: public V put(K key, V value)
li.div:
Maps the specified key to the specified value in this hashtable. Neither the key nor the value can be null.
The value can be retrieved by calling the get method with a key that is equal to the original key.

dl.dd: put in interface Map<K,V>
put in class Dictionary<K,V>
key - the hashtable key
value - the value
the previous value of the specified key in this hashtable, or null if it did not have one
NullPointerException - if the key or value is null
Object.equals(Object), get(Object)

li.div: Removes the key (and its corresponding value) from this hashtable. This method does nothing if the key is not in the hashtable.

dl.dd: remove in interface Map<K,V>
remove in class Dictionary<K,V>
key - the key that needs to be removed
the value to which the key had been mapped in this hashtable, or null if the key did not have a mapping
NullPointerException - if the key is null

li.pre: public void putAll(Map<? extends K,? extends V> t)
li.div: Copies all of the mappings from the specified map to this hashtable. These mappings will replace any mappings that this hashtable had for any of the keys currently in the specified map.

dl.dd: putAll in interface Map<K,V>
t - mappings to be stored in this map
NullPointerException - if the specified map is null

li.div: Clears this hashtable so that it contains no keys.

dl.dd: clear in interface Map<K,V>

li.div: Creates a shallow copy of this hashtable. All the structure of the hashtable itself is copied, but the keys and values are not cloned. This is a relatively expensive operation.

dl.dd: clone in class Object
a clone of the hashtable

li.div: Returns a string representation of this Hashtable object in the form of a set of entries, enclosed in braces and separated by the ASCII characters ", " (comma and space). Each entry is rendered as the key, an equals sign =, and the associated element, where the toString method is used to convert the key and element to strings.

dl.dd: toString in class Object
a string representation of this hashtable

li.div: Returns a Set view of the keys contained in this map. The set is backed by the map, so changes to the map are reflected in the set, and vice-versa. If the map is modified while an iteration over the set is in progress (except through the iterator's own remove operation), the results of the iteration are undefined. The set supports element removal, which removes the corresponding mapping from the map, via the Iterator.remove, Set.remove, removeAll, retainAll, and clear operations. It does not support the add or addAll operations.

dl.dd: keySet in interface Map<K,V>
a set view of the keys contained in this map

li.div: Returns a Set view of the mappings contained in this map. The set is backed by the map, so changes to the map are reflected in the set, and vice-versa. If the map is modified while an iteration over the set is in progress (except through the iterator's own remove operation, or through the setValue operation on a map entry returned by the iterator) the results of the iteration are undefined. The set supports element removal, which removes the corresponding mapping from the map, via the Iterator.remove, Set.remove, removeAll, retainAll and clear operations. It does not support the add or addAll operations.

dl.dd: entrySet in interface Map<K,V>
a set view of the mappings contained in this map

li.div: Returns a Collection view of the values contained in this map. The collection is backed by the map, so changes to the map are reflected in the collection, and vice-versa. If the map is modified while an iteration over the collection is in progress (except through the iterator's own remove operation), the results of the iteration are undefined. The collection supports element removal, which removes the corresponding mapping from the map, via the Iterator.remove, Collection.remove, removeAll, retainAll and clear operations. It does not support the add or addAll operations.

dl.dd: values in interface Map<K,V>
a collection view of the values contained in this map

li.div: Compares the specified Object with this Map for equality, as per the definition in the Map interface.

equals in class Object

hashCode in class Object
a hash code value for this object.
